resources.string: This help was performed on a Google Pixel phone with an unmodified Android version. Depending on your smartphone manufacturer, the operations may be slightly different.
Open the quick settings drawer by pulling down from top of the screen
Tap and drag the tile named \"Keep screen on\" into the top area of the window
Tap back and return to this app

Keep your screen on smartly! 

KeepOn allows you to keep your device's screen on for the desired duration and also allows you to return to the default settings when the screen turns off. 
The application is free and open-source, without any ads/analytics.

KeepOn adapts to your device's configuration for easy use! 

The default value is automatically selected and retained for reapplication. 

You can change the default value without leaving KeepOn, just press and hold the desired value.
KeepOn detects by default when the screen turns off to reapply the initial value! \n\nThis setting can be disabled at any time in the settings.

You can change the appearance of the Quick Settings tile from the pane at the bottom of the screen. \n\nYou can also change the screen timeout by clicking on the preview on the left side of this pane.
KeepOn is natively integrated with automation apps that support Tasker plugin. \n\nThanks to the plugin you can extend the possibilities of KeepOn to infinity.

Once the configuration is complete, simply add the KeepOn tile to the Android Quick Settings to use it! \n\nA Tasker/Locale plugin is integrated and allows you to use KeepOn functions from another compatible application!
This permission is required for the application to work!

Hey there! You seem to like this app, would you mind visiting the Play Store and give a rating? It would help me a great deal! \n\nIf instead you hate this app, we would love to hear your feedback so we can improve. Thanks!
Hey, you seem to like this app. You would help me a great deal with a 5-star rating!
